p: Unclear results come from publications focusing on ameliorating effect of (hydroxy)chloroquine over cytokine storm in COVID-19 patients [ 50]. Similar unexplicit results were published by He et al. in metaanalysis upon clinical evidence that even though ulinastatin, a serine protease inhibitor, suppresses pro-inflammatory cytokine elevation and upregulates the release of anti-inflammatory mediators. Because of the poor quality of the evaluated trials and the small cohorts, their findings should be interpreted cautiously [ 51]. Even macrolides have long been recognised to modulate immune- and anti-inflammatory actions. They suppress the “cytokine storm” in selected patients, yet the confirmation of their effect in larger series is still awaited [ 52].
